pages.text: Insead of skipping the night, the world is sped up while you're asleep. $(br2)You can now sleep at any time, as long as you have enough fatigue, which you gain passively over time. Be careful though - letting it build up might have negative side effects.

The most effective way to reduce fatigue is sleeping. However, if you are away from home or missing a bed, you can dring coffee to reduce fatigue. $(br)Fatigue is displayed on screen as an overlay. While the player's fatigue is updated every tick, the display is only updated every 5 seconds (100 ticks).

It's recommended to keep an eye on your fatigue, as getting too tired will result in some debuffs. These debuff will be applied only once for a certain period of time when you enter a new side effect stage. The last side effect is permanent. $(br1)$(li)70 fatigue: Nausea $(br1)$(li)80 fatigue: Slowness II $(br1)$(li)90 fatigue: Poison $(br1)$(li)95+ fatigue: Slowness III
